keywords: convenience@serve with salad for complete meal
subtitle: This four-filling flan combines a wonderful selection of flavours - it is great for picnics and buffet lunches.

method.text: Sift the flour and seasoning into a bowl. Stir in the mustard. Rub in the butter until the mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs. Add enough cold water to form a smooth dough.
Roll out on a lightly floured surface and use to line a 23 cm deep round flan tin.

Roll out the pastry trimmings into a long sausage. Then flatten and cut into 4 equal lengths. Use these to divide the inside of the flan case into quarters, by making a cross, fixing the sides with a little cold water. Chill for 30 min.

Line the flan case with pieces of greaseproof paper and baking beans. Bake blind in the oven for 15 min. Remove the paper and beans and bake for a further 5 min or until golden and cooked. Reduce oven heat to 180°C.
Meanwhile, in a bowl, mix together one of the eggs with 50 ml of the cream and the tomato, salami, tomato puree, chives and seasoning to taste.
In another bowl, mix together one egg with 50 ml of the cream, the sweetcorn, chicken, parsley, soy sauce and seasoning to taste.
In another bowl mix together one egg, 50 ml of the cream, the prawns, trout, capers, Worcestershire sauce, anchovy essence, dill and seasoning.
In the last bowl mix together the remaining egg, 50 ml of the cream, the garlic, Parmesan, basil and seasoning.
Spoon each of the fillings into a separate section of the flan case. Place the case on a baking tray and bake in oven for 25-30 min, or until set and golden brown. Serve hot or cold.

title: Four seasons flan
